Implement IDisposable on 'Sound' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'WaveOutEvent'. If 'Sound' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Implement IDisposable on 'Background' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'Texture2D'. If 'Background' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Implement IDisposable on 'Section' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'DebugForm'. If 'Section' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Rule.Name: Declare event handlers correctly
Rule.Description: By convention, .NET events have two parameters that specify the event sender and event data. Event handler signatures should follow this form: void MyEventHandler(object sender, EventArgs e). The 'sender' parameter is always of type System.Object, even if it is possible to employ a more specific type. The 'e' parameter is always of type System.EventArgs. Events that do not provide event data should use the System.EventHandler delegate type. Event handlers return void so that they can send each event to multiple target methods. Any value returned by a target would be lost after the first call.
Rule.Resolution: Declare the first parameter of {0} as an object named 'sender'.
Declare the second parameter of {0} as an EventArgs, or an instance of a type that extends EventArgs, named 'e'.

Rule.Name: Mark ISerializable types with SerializableAttribute
Rule.Description: The System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface allows the type to customize its serialization, while the Serializable attribute enables the runtime to recognize the type as being serializable.
Rule.Resolution: Add [Serializable] to {0} as this type implements ISerializable.

Rule.Name: Mark Windows Forms entry points with STAThread
Rule.Description: Assemblies that reference System.Windows.Forms should have the STAThreadAttribute. Failure to apply this attribute will most likely result in an application that does not work. Windows Forms relies on a number of components that use the STA model.
Rule.Resolution: Mark the entry point method {0} in assembly {1} with an STAThreadAttribute.

Rule.TypeName: Provide correct arguments to formatting methods
Rule.Name: Provide correct arguments to formatting methods
Rule.Description: Provide the correct number of arguments to String.Format calls.
Rule.Resolution: Method {0} calls {1} and does not provide a format item for argument {2}. The provided format string is: '{3}'

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
